text: The following English statements are given * Anyone passing his history exams and winning the lottery is happy * Anyone who studies or is lucky can pass his exams Â« John did not study * John is lucky * Anyone who Is lucky wins the lottery The statements can be written as follows in conjunctive normal form 1 ~pass(x,history) v ~win(x,lottery) v happy(x) 2 -study(x) v pass(x,y) 3 -lucky(x) v pass(x,y) 4 -study(john) 5 lucky(john) 6 =lucky(x) v win(x,lottery) 31 Use resolution refutation to prove that John is happy, using the assumptions in the (10) paragraph above 32 What does it mean to say that resolution is refutation-complete? 2)
